info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Catawba and western Lincoln Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 448 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles south of Hickory, or near Mountain View, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Newton, Lincolnton, Conover, Maiden, Mountain View, Longview, St. Stephens, Vale and Startown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
